page.title: 19THE VILLAGE OF MESSING
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF MESSING The village lies about one mile north of Tiptree.It is a pretty spread out village with interesting houses,a pub, a Post Office,a school and a church. ALL SAINTS CHURCH, MESSING The church is in the middle of the village.It is mainly built of rubble but the tower is of brick.The tower has a clock on three sides and in 1985 they are being repaired and regilded. The vicar and his father are doing the painting and gilding.The clock mechanism was built in 1809 by Thwaites and Reed Ltd.,who look after Big Ben. MESSING SCHOOL This is one of the smallest schools in the County of Essex with twenty pupils on roll with a Headmaster and one teacher.
